main.name: Luca Alexander Weissbeck
main.description: I am a software engineering student at IBM and will have completed my studies in September 2022
main.bio: My studies involve recurring internships at my corporate partner IBM. While this might seem uncommon, it is a well known concept in Germany. During my studies a practical work experience phase alternates with a university phase every 3-4 months. Due to my free choice of internship placement I am able to gain insights into different business units and work on real-world client facing projects.
main.contactmessage: Feel free to contact me on the options listed below.

resume.skillmessage: These include some of my skills I have acquired through my internships but also out of my pivate interest.

education.degree: Bsc. International Management for Business and Information Technology
education.description: Describe your experience at school, what you learned, what useful skills you have acquired etc.

work.company: Tech4Justice - Identifying Racial and Gender Bias using NLP
work.title: IBM Research - Tech4Justice
work.description:
The Tech4Justice department at IBM Hursley deals with technology developed for a greater good of society. During my time at the department I was tasked with finding algorithms that give an answer to the research question; "Is there too much information given in newspaper articles in context surrounding particular negative events when involving members of a minority group?". Answers to this question may be found by analysis of racial bias. An elevated amount of hedges, boosters or factive verbs in articles may be one of the many factors portraying such a bias by the newspaper author.
The analysis were conducted in Python using a Dataframe containing the article content and other metadata.

Technology stack: Python, NLTK, Pandas, NumPy, TextBlob, Sci-kit-learn, IBM Cloud, IBM Watson Natural Language Processing, CoreNLP

work.company: Development & Deployment GitHub Changelog Application IBM Cloud Code Engine
work.title: IBM Research - Code Engine
work.description:
IBM Cloud Code Engine presents a recent offering of the IBM Cloud allowing developers to deploy software serverless. The developer solely needs to provide his source code or deployment container while Cloud Code Engine takes care of the rest.
We were tasked with the development of an application allowing the user to connect to any of his authorised GitHub repositories and automatically creating changelog messages by utilising the GitHub API in order to establish the differences between each version published on GitHub. 
The application's API was written in Node.js while the frontend was developed using ReactJS in combination with Typescript as well as IBM's design kit "Carbon Design".

Technology stack: NodeJS, ReactJS, Docker, Cloud Code Engine (IBM Cloud), Typescript, Javascript, HTML, CSS, IBM Carbon Design

work.company: Development of DevOps Creator in AngularJS
work.title: IBM - BMW Account
work.description: During my third internship I joined the GBS BMW account located in the IoT center in Munich. My main focus laid on developing a frontend application that can be used to easily build and deploy DevOps solutions in the most efficient manner.  The frontend was developed using the well known web framework Angular in combination with Java Script. Meanwhile the backend made use of the Sequelize ORM integrated into a Node.js backend. Sequelize is an Object-relational mapping framework used to communicate with the database.  Furthermore, I gained insights into the AWS Cloud and was able to achieve the AWS Cloud Practitioner certificate.  Technology stack: AngularJS, Javascript, NodeJS, HTML, CSS, AWS Cloud

work.company: Deutsches Museum Showcase - Artificial Intelligence Optimisation for Object Recognition
work.title: IBM - IoT Center Munich
work.description: In my second practical experience I was tasked with the optimisation and training of an artificial neural network used for object detection at the German museum in Nuremberg. Training a neural network in Python using MxNet requires the use of Hyperparameters which influence the quality and performance of the network inference heavily. The ongoing COVID - 19 pandemic impeded training the model locally at IBM, resulting in the use of a docker container which was started via an SSH - access to a high - performance computer. Technology stack: Python, MxNet, OpenCV, Docker

work.company: Storage Infrastructure for AI, Autonomous Driving and Data Science
work.title: IBM Systems Storage
work.description: Having spent three months at the IBM Systems storage department, I was able to gain a great insight into the software-defined storage but also hardware storage of IBM. The main focus laid on providing the autonomous driving sector with capable storage for AI & Big Data and applications. This specific market needs a strong IT infrastructure in order to run AI simulations faster than realtime, and store the enormous amounts of data collected by the sensors of an autonomous driving vehicle. What makes this challenge interesting, is that not one solution fits all customers but every solution is tailored to the customer's specific needs.
